svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
October 7, 2023" date: "2023-10-06"
Eth News and Links
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade
* Latest all core devs â€“ consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Christine Kim :
Devnet-9: testing finding issues , MEV-Boost testing started (20% of the network)
Devnet-10: launch once no issues on devnet-9, short lived, to include KZG ceremony
Goerli testnet upgrade timing: still too early to set a date
Latest all core devs â€“ consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Christine Kim :
* Devnet-9: testing finding issues , MEV-Boost testing started (20% of the network)
* Devnet-10: launch once no issues on devnet-9, short lived, to include KZG ceremony
* Goerli testnet upgrade timing: still too early to set a date
* Dencun interop testing call video
Dencun interop testing call video
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* ðŸš¨ Lido at 32.13% has slightly reduced but still far too close to 33.3% threshold
ðŸš¨ Lido at 32.13% has slightly reduced but still far too close to 33.3% threshold
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth ~80%
supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split Consensus layer: Prysm at 45%, any
client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth ~80% supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split
Execution layer: Geth ~80% supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split
* Consensus layer: Prysm at 45%, any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Consensus layer: Prysm at 45%, any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
* Geographic diversity needed for stakers & nodes , particularly outside of US/Can/EU
Geographic diversity needed for stakers & nodes , particularly outside of US/Can/EU
Layer 1
* Blutgang : RPC load balancer & cache, in Rust
Blutgang : RPC load balancer & cache, in Rust
* Revm v3.5.0 : transitioned to Alloy types
Revm v3.5.0 : transitioned to Alloy types
* Geth & Reth allow sync to historical hash
Geth & Reth allow sync to historical hash
* Besu (execution layer client) Bonsai Tries storage explainer
Besu (execution layer client) Bonsai Tries storage explainer
* Verkle implementers call notes
Verkle implementers call notes
For Stakers
* Stakesaurus: guide to home staking , aimed at novices
Client releases
* Execution layer: Erigon v2.51.0 : fixes
* Erigon v2.51.0 : fixes
Layer 2
* OP Stack fault proof system live on OP Goerli testnet, alpha
OP Stack fault proof system live on OP Goerli testnet, alpha
* Metis (optimistic rollup) reverting to storing transaction data on mainnet
Metis (optimistic rollup) reverting to storing transaction data on mainnet
* EIP4844 economics : model rollup costs for posting on blobs and blocks
EIP4844 economics : model rollup costs for posting on blobs and blocks
EIPs/Standards
* EIPs EIP7530 : EVM profiles for zk rollups
EIPs
* EIP7530 : EVM profiles for zk rollups
* ERCs (application layer): ERC7527 : Token bound function oracle AMM contract ERC7528
: ETH (native asset) address convention (0xe) ERC7529 : Contract discovery and eTLD+1
association ERC7531 : Staked ERC721 ownership recognition
ERCs (application layer):
* ERC7527 : Token bound function oracle AMM contract
ERC7527 : Token bound function oracle AMM contract
* ERC7528 : ETH (native asset) address convention (0xe)
ERC7528 : ETH (native asset) address convention (0xe)
* ERC7529 : Contract discovery and eTLD+1 association
ERC7529 : Contract discovery and eTLD+1 association
* ERC7531 : Staked ERC721 ownership recognition
ERC7531 : Staked ERC721 ownership recognition
Holding Lido publicly accountable: interview with Ben Edgington
Lido governance is not fit for purpose.Â Donâ€™t miss this episode with Ben Edgington .
(Watch on YouTube )
Ben also talks about his Upgrading Ethereum book and Ethereum governance.
Stuff for developers
* OpenZeppelin Contracts v5 : Adds AccessManager, GovernorStorage, ERC2771Forwarder,
ERC1967Utils, Nonces, MessageHashUtils and Time Removals include: Address.isContract,
Counters, ERC777, SafeMath, TokenTimelock, escrow contracts and all presets Uses
custom errors, explicit imports and Solidity compiler minimum of v0.8.20
OpenZeppelin Contracts v5 :
* Adds AccessManager, GovernorStorage, ERC2771Forwarder, ERC1967Utils, Nonces,
MessageHashUtils and Time
Adds AccessManager, GovernorStorage, ERC2771Forwarder, ERC1967Utils, Nonces,
* Removals include: Address.isContract, Counters, ERC777, SafeMath, TokenTimelock,
escrow contracts and all presets
Removals include: Address.isContract, Counters, ERC777, SafeMath, TokenTimelock,
* Uses custom errors, explicit imports and Solidity compiler minimum of v0.8.20
Uses custom errors, explicit imports and Solidity compiler minimum of v0.8.20
* Hardhat v2.18.0 : adds support for scoped tasks
Hardhat v2.18.0 : adds support for scoped tasks
* Foundry: Forge-std v1.7.0 / v1.7.1 : adds serializeJson cheat code, unixTime, marks
parseJsonKeys as pure and renames exit_code to exitCode Vulcan v0.4.0 : adds unwrap to
obtain result value, set custom revert message with expect, isOk & isError for
improved error handling and interaction with external HTTP servers Scope (VS Code
extension): Remix-like & visual wrapper of some Foundry features, alpha
Foundry:
* Forge-std v1.7.0 / v1.7.1 : adds serializeJson cheat code, unixTime, marks
parseJsonKeys as pure and renames exit_code to exitCode
Forge-std v1.7.0 / v1.7.1 : adds serializeJson cheat code, unixTime, marks
* Vulcan v0.4.0 : adds unwrap to obtain result value, set custom revert message with
expect, isOk & isError for improved error handling and interaction with external HTTP
servers
Vulcan v0.4.0 : adds unwrap to obtain result value, set custom revert message with
* Scope (VS Code extension): Remix-like & visual wrapper of some Foundry features,
alpha
Scope (VS Code extension): Remix-like & visual wrapper of some Foundry features, alpha
* Huff: Huff-test : macros for pure Huff test assertions Py-huff : Huff compiler in
Python Zyclone : mixer in Huff (similar to Tornado Cash), gas optimized ~5x cheaper to
deposit
Huff:
* Huff-test : macros for pure Huff test assertions
Huff-test : macros for pure Huff test assertions
* Py-huff : Huff compiler in Python
Py-huff : Huff compiler in Python
* Zyclone : mixer in Huff (similar to Tornado Cash), gas optimized ~5x cheaper to
Zyclone : mixer in Huff (similar to Tornado Cash), gas optimized ~5x cheaper to
* Vyper v0.3.10 : adds codesize optimization mode, pragma directives, uses MCOPY in
generated code and generates selector tables with O(1) performance
Vyper v0.3.10 : adds codesize optimization mode, pragma directives, uses MCOPY in
* CTFs: Secureum RACE #22: 8 question Solidity quiz & answers by Tincho
CTFs:
* Secureum RACE #22: 8 question Solidity quiz & answers by Tincho
Ecosystem
* Vitalik on enshrining & de-enshrining features in the protocol : account
abstraction, zk-EVMs, proposer-builder separation, private transaction pools, liquid
staking and precompiles
Vitalik on enshrining & de-enshrining features in the protocol : account abstraction,
zk-EVMs, proposer-builder separation, private transaction pools, liquid staking and
precompiles
* Ethereum.org writers cohort 2 starts October 20
Ethereum.org writers cohort 2 starts October 20
* Etherscan event log advanced filter
Etherscan event log advanced filter
Enterprise
* UBS pilot tokenized Variable Capital Company (VCC) fund as part of Monetary
Authority of Singaporeâ€™s Project Guardian
Onchain stats
* Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 4.7 to 93.7 gwei, with 9.9 gwei average Negative
issuance currently at 21.2 gwei 8.6k ETH net issuance this week
Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 4.7 to 93.7 gwei, with 9.9 gwei average
* Negative issuance currently at 21.2 gwei
Negative issuance currently at 21.2 gwei
* 8.6k ETH net issuance this week
8.6k ETH net issuance this week
* ETHUSD : $1,611 - $1,736, currently $1,646
ETHUSD : $1,611 - $1,736, currently $1,646
* ETHBTC : currently 0.059 (Flippening at ~0.16)
ETHBTC : currently 0.059 (Flippening at ~0.16)
Notable at app layer
* Winding down: Yield Protocol and Utopia product
Winding down: Yield Protocol and Utopia product
* NFT no code creation: OpenSea Studio (10% mint fee) mint.fun create (0.0002 ETH mint
fee) Zora (gas free creation on Zora Network, 0.000111 ETH mint fee)
NFT no code creation:
* OpenSea Studio (10% mint fee)
OpenSea Studio (10% mint fee)
* mint.fun create (0.0002 ETH mint fee)
mint.fun create (0.0002 ETH mint fee)
* Zora (gas free creation on Zora Network, 0.000111 ETH mint fee)
Zora (gas free creation on Zora Network, 0.000111 ETH mint fee)
* RACâ€™s Deadline NFT live on Base, purchase from mainnet or Layer 2 [Andrew minted]
RACâ€™s Deadline NFT live on Base, purchase from mainnet or Layer 2 [Andrew minted]
* Friend Tech add/remove log in methods after SIM swap attacks
Friend Tech add/remove log in methods after SIM swap attacks
* Nature: DAOs for scientific communities and alternative research funding
Nature: DAOs for scientific communities and alternative research funding
Job Listings
* eBay Web3 team seeking Lead Solidity Engineer
eBay Web3 team seeking Lead Solidity Engineer
* Aave seek a UX Engineer and a Staff Rust Engineer
Aave seek a UX Engineer and a Staff Rust Engineer
* Senior Operations Security Expert wanted by EF
Senior Operations Security Expert wanted by EF
* EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team seek a Technical Project Coordinator
EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team seek a Technical Project Coordinator
* ZK circuits engineer sought by EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team
ZK circuits engineer sought by EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team
Job listings: $600 for four issues (75 character limit).Â Questions? abcoathup
at-gmail
Regulation/business/tokens
* Coinbase licenced by the Monetary Authority of Singapore
Coinbase licenced by the Monetary Authority of Singapore
* VanEck to donate 10% of EFUT ETF profits to Protocol Guild
VanEck to donate 10% of EFUT ETF profits to Protocol Guild
* ENS DAO reducing Lido exposure to maximum 20%
ENS DAO reducing Lido exposure to maximum 20%
General
* Roman Storm available for work
Roman Storm available for work
* Vitalik reflects on Zuzalu (popup mini city)
Vitalik reflects on Zuzalu (popup mini city)
* Guide to secure Discord servers
Guide to secure Discord servers
* zk-Bench : benchmarking framework for SNARKs
zk-Bench : benchmarking framework for SNARKs
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @abcoathup
and @evan_van_ness to get most of the weekâ€™s news in real time.
Permalink for this weekâ€™s issue:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-october-7-2023
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )
* Oct 13-15 â€“ Ethereum Kuala Lumpur conference & hackathon
Oct 13-15 â€“ Ethereum Kuala Lumpur conference & hackathon

Oct 27-29 â€“ ETH Miami festival & hackathon

Oct 28-30 â€“ Paradigm CTF
* Oct 31 â€“ Road to Devcon grants deadline (max $1k for local meetups)

* Nov 3-5 â€“ ETHBrno
